intro: Tapanhuacanga psyllocarpoides, commonly known as the golden leaf tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking golden-yellow leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in humid montane forests. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several small, smooth seeds. Tapanhuacanga psyllocarpoides is valued for its ornamental beauty and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
